ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a lot about contemporary British politics, culture, and the institution of the British monarchy.
Understanding of the British monarchy, British history, the culture of the UK.

This class helped to change the way I look at and critique things. By focusing on one show, we were able to entirely pick it apart. It was cool talking about the cinematic choices while also learning about the British and world history at the time. The show was "put under the lens" of our class.
Analysis of media, current news articles, critical thinking.
I learned some writing and historical analysis skills. I also learned a LOT about the British Monarchy.
Learned about British history and the royal family
New knowledge of British history specifically the royal family. Lots of good writing tips as well
A lot about British history, the royal family, and relevance/accuracy of The Crown
I learned how to think critically about the relative facts and falsehoods presented in a work of historical fiction.
What is a constitutional monarchy, and the reasons for and against it. A deeper knowledge of the British monarchy (royal family). How and why does the monarchy matter or doesnt matter.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course was extremely engaging in using a piece of modern media to gain better insight into British politics and culture from the twentieth century. The main strength was in the material.
So entertaining and engaging, really fun work, awesome class.

I like that we would watch the episodes before class. The readings were short and concise so that I really got the point of what each one was saying.  The class was not always the most engaged. Some students barely spoke, so I wish it was more of a class discussion rather than us just one on one responding to Professor Semmel.
Strengths: very engaging, the history portion of the course tied really well into the TV show, the structure of the course made a lot of sense and aided in engagement

Prof. Semmel was definitely the course's greatest strength. He's a fantastic professor.

I think there should be a bit more structure. The readings were interesting, but we didn't do too much with them. I also think there should maybe be a few specific things from the episodes to discuss, at least at the start, so the discussions feel a bit more structured.
Definitely fun watching the show and discussing with piers. I thought the workload was good, but fair

Strengths - loved the show very interesting

Weaknesses - readings werent that relevant

A strength is the discussion based nature of the course, which allowed us to explore topics which interested us in depth. I would have preferred more required engagement with historical research. It's interesting to google various plot points as they appear, but having assignments or readings that explore the historical accuracies of the show would have been very cool.

Strength: Very chill and nice class discussions, light and interesting readings.

Weakness: The class can feel a bit unstructured at times. You are not going to learn a lot of hard-core knowledge. Most of the class are simply spent discussing episodes of the crown. Do not take this class if you find the TV show boring or mediocre.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course to another student because Professor Semmel is an engaging teacher and the class discussions were very interesting to understanding the time period.
Absolutely. Such a great community and so interesting.
Yes, I think this was a great first-year seminar on an interesting, current topic. Professor Semmel was also a great teacher to lead the course and had the best attitude.

Yes! This was a super engaging class and it was super fun watching The Crown along with several other movies in the class. It is a class that requires several hours of commitment each week, as we went through 3-5 episodes (3-5 hours) plus several readings a week. However, it was worth it and I learned a lot. We had three papers throughout the class, and none were too difficult to write, though I would not recommend it as a fifth "gut" class as the time commitment is quite high if you truly want to engage in the class.
I would, if they're interested in the show and/or the monarchy.
Yes, I loved this course. Professor semmel was great and the topic remained engaging throughout the semester
So interesting for anyone that doesnt know about this history and hasnt watched the show
Yes - very interesting and fun to take

Yes, as it was a very interesting course that allowed me to disengage from my psets and think about history, screenwriting, direction, and looking at a television show as a kind of text available for analysis.
Yes! If you love the Crown and are interested in the British monarchy, definitely take this class. Professor Semmel is great!
